Sequence Information.Source: screen from rice genome,Oryza rufipogonGriff, plants

Literature.Author: Li J, Islam S, Guo P, Hu X, Dong W.2020
Literature.Reference: Int J Mol Sci. 2020 Nov 18;21(22):8722. doi: 10.3390/ijms21228722.PubMed
Literature.Title: Isolation of Antimicrobial Genes from Oryza rufipogon Griff by Using a Bacillussubtilis Expression System with Potential Antimicrobial Activities.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (34.29%) toCycloviolacin VY1Activity: active against C. fangi (MIC 10.7 uM), C. michiganensis (MIC 10.5 uM), X. oryzae pv. oryzae (MIC 10.1 uM), R. solanacearum  (MIC 8.1 uM), X. oryzae pv. oryzicola (MIC 7.7 uM), and B. subtilis 168 (MIC 8.3 uM).MOA:bacteria: act on membranes, ROS release.Toxicity: no hemolysis at 3xMIC or 150 uM: not hemo.lytic.
